name: Total Production
initiative:
Total crop production in kilocalories

We converted all tonnes of production to kilocalories so we can compare across all crops. In our dataset, we also converted production to fats and proteins.

Farm size responsible for majority of production

name: Food
initiative:
Food production in kilocalories

We converted all tonnes of production to kilocalories. Then we applied the percent of feed, food, processing, seed, waste, or other based on FAO's food balance sheets. For example, in many countries maize can be used for human consumption, animal feed, a processed biofuel commodity, and seed, while some maize may be lost due to storage and transportation. In our dataset, we split up or sub-national production data based on the FAO's national allocations.

Farm size responsible for majority of production

name: Crop Diverstiy
initiative:
Crop diversity

Crop diversity is a simple count of how many unique crop species each farm size produced (this is also called 'species richness' in the biodiversity literature). Many countries' surveys only captured a set number of crops so there isn't much difference between farm size classes. For the countries that captured a lot of different crops (e.g., Peru and Colombia) our data shows a big difference between small and large farms.

Farm size responsible for majority of diversity
